revised_title: Punic Coin Analysis from the Isle of Gozo
tldr: The author examines a Punic coin from the Isle of Gozo and discusses its design, inscriptions, and historical context. The coin features a veiled woman's head on one side and three Egyptian figures on the other. The author compares the coin to similar ones from Malta and analyzes the inscriptions, which may provide insight into the ancient Phoenician culture and religion in the region.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
